result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler R. STAAB

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody on probation hold.
State moves to dismiss and read in both counts.  Defendant plead to a charge of battery in 14 CF 391.  Motion granted.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 12-12-14 at 3:30 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 11-26-14 at 3:45 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of battery by prisoner.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-24-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no contact with Marcos Carreno.  Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody serving a sentence.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
